item.title: 100% Cook's Assistant Quest! [PI or any base] 100% accurate! Well-explained!
item.dc:creator: @skillnocb skillnocb
item.description:
@skillnocb wrote:

Hey man i get an error when i add CooksAssisstantQuestHandler.handleButton(c, actionButtonId); to my clickingbuttons.java

This is the error src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:2010: error: cannot find s ymbol case 28164: CooksAssisstantQuestHandler.handleButton (c, actionButtonId); // item kept on death ^ symbol: variable CooksAssisstantQuestHandler location: class ClickingButtons Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.source: 100% Cook's Assistant Quest! [PI or any base] 100% accurate! Well-explained!

item.title: 100% Cook's Assistant Quest! [PI or any base] 100% accurate! Well-explained!
item.dc:creator: @Level_120_Dungeoneer Level 120 Dungeoneering
item.description:
@Level_120_Dungeoneer wrote:

This took me a while to write out, so please comment and tell me if you like it, if I could improve, or if I should release more quests!

First make a new class called CooksAssisstantQuestHandler.

Add this into it:

package netty.content.FTPquests;

import netty.event.Event;
import netty.event.EventContainer;
import netty.event.EventManager;
import netty.model.players.Client;
import netty.util.Misc;
import netty.model.players.Client;
import netty.model.players.ActionAssistant2;
import netty.model.players.Player;

public class CooksAssisstantQuestHandler {
   
   public Client c;
   public static int quest_1;

      String s1 = "Bucket of milk";
      String s2 = "Pot of Flour";
      String s3 = "1 Egg";

      if(c.getPA().playerHasItem(1927,1)){
        s1 = "@str@Bucket of milk";
      }
      if(c.getPA().playerHasItem(1933,1)){
        s2 = "@str@Pot of Flour";
      }
      if(c.getPA().playerHasItem(1944,1)){
        s3 = "@str@1 Egg";
      }
   
   public static void handleButton(Client c, int id) {
      if (id == 28164) {
         switch(c.quest_1){ 
         //Start the Quest.

         case 0:
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("Cook's Assisstant", 7332);
            c.getPA().clearQuestInterface();
            c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("Cook's Assisstant Quest",8144);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("I can start this quest by talking to the Cook.",8147);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("He is located in the Lumbridge Castle.",8148);
            break;
            
         case 1:
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Cook's Assisstant", 7332);
            c.getPA().clearQuestInterface();
            c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("Cook's Assisstant Quest",8144);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@I can start this quest by talking to the Cook.",8147);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@He is located in the Lumbridge Castle.",8148);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("The Cook has asked you to get the following items:",8149);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("s3",8150);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("s1",8151);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("s2",8152);
            break;
            
         case 2:
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@Cook's Assisstant", 7332);
            c.getPA().clearQuestInterface();
            c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("Cook's Assisstant Quest",8144);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@I can start this quest by talking to the Cook.",8147);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@He is located in the Lumbridge Castle.",8148);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@The Cook has asked you to get the following items:",8149);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126(@str@+s3,8150);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126(@str@+s1,8151);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126(@str@+s2,8152);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@red@QUEST COMPLETED",8153);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("",8154);
            c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
            break;
         }
      }
   }

   public static void firstClickNpc(Client c, int npcId) {
      switch (npcId) {
      case 278:
         if (c.quest_1 == 0) {
            c.getDH().sendDialogues(1, npcId);
         } else if (c.quest_1 == 1 && c.getItems().playerHasItem(1933, 1)
               && c.getItems().playerHasItem(1944, 1)
               && c.getItems().playerHasItem(1927, 1)) {
            c.getDH().sendDialogues(7, npcId);

         break;
         }
      }
   }

Add this into case 28164 in your ClickingButtons class:

CooksAssisstantQuestHandler.handleButton(c, actionButtonId);

Now, open your ActionHandler class and add this into your case 278:

CooksAssisstantQuestHandler.firstClickNpc(c, npcType);

Now go to your DialogueHandler class, and add this:

      /**
       * Cook's assisstant quest start
       */
      case 1:
         sendNpcChat3("Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear I'm in a terrible terrible",
                   "mess! It's the Duke's birthday today, and I should be",
                   "making him a lovely big birthday cake.", c.talkingNpc,
               "Cook");
         c.nextChat = 2;
         break;
      case 2:
sendNpcChat4("I`ve forgotten to buy the ingredients. I`ll never get",
                   "them in time now. He`ll sack me! What will I do? I have",
                   "four children and a goat to look after. Would you help", 
                  "me please?", c.talkingNpc,
               "Cook");
         c.nextChat = 3;
         break;

      case 3:
         sendPlayerChat1("I'm always happy to help an cook in distress.");
         c.dialogueAction = 104;
         c.quest_1 = 1;
         c.getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Cook's Assisstant", 7332);
         c.nextChat = 5;
         break;
         
      case 4:
         
      case 5:
         sendNpcChat2("Thank you very much! I need an",
               "egg, a bucket of milk and a pot of flour.", c.talkingNpc, "Cook");
         c.nextChat = 6;
         break;
         
      case 6:
         sendPlayerChat1("Okay, I'll see what I can do.");
         c.nextChat = 0;
         break;
         
      case 7:
         sendNpcChat2("How are you getting on with finding",
               " the ingredients?", c.talkingNpc,
               "Cook");

         c.nextChat = 8;
         break;
         
      case 8:
      sendPlayerChat2("Here's a bucket of milk, a pot of",
               "flour, and a fresh egg.");
      c.getItems().deleteItem2(1944, 1);
      c.getItems().deleteItem2(1927, 1);
      c.getItems().deleteItem2(1933, 1);
      c.nextChat = 9;
      break;
      
      case 9:
         sendNpcChat2("You've brought me everything I need! I am saved!",
               "Thank you!", c.talkingNpc, "Cook");
         c.nextChat = 10;
      break;
      
      case 10:
            sendPlayerChat1("So do I get to go the Duke's Party?");
            c.nextChat = 11;
        break;
     
      case 11:
            sendNpcChat2("I'm afraid not, only the big cheeses get to dine", "with the Duke.", c.talkingNpc, "Cook");
            c.nextChat = 12;
        break;

       case 12:
            sendPlayerChat2("Well, maybe one day I'll be important enough to sit on", "the Duke's table.");
            c.nextChat = 13;
        break;
    
       case 13:
            sendNpcChat1("Maybe, but I won't be holding my breath.", c.talkingNpc, "Cook");
            c.nextChat = 14;
        break;
        
      case 14:
         c.getPA().QuestReward(c, "Cook's Assisstant", 2, "300 cooking experience.", "1 Quest Point.", "","","","", 1949);
         c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
         c.questPoints += 2;
         c.quest_1 = 2;
         c.sendMessage("Congratulations, you have completed Cook's Assisstant quest.");
         c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Quest Points: " + c.questPoints, 640);
         c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@Cook's Assisstant", 7332);
         c.getPA().addSkillXP(300, c.playerCooking);
         c.nextChat = 0;
         break;
      case 15:
         sendNpcChat1("Feel free to use my range whenever you please!",
               "", c.talkingNpc,
               "Cook");
         c.nextChat = 0;
         break;

Add this to your Player class:

public int quest_1;

Add this to your PlayerSave class:

               } else if (token.equals("questPoints")) {
                  p.questPoints = Integer.parseInt(token2);
               } else if (token.equals("quest_1")) {
                  p.quest_1 = Integer.parseInt(token2);
               }

Also add this to your PlayerSave class:

         characterfile.write("[QUESTS]", 0, 8);
         characterfile.newLine();
         characterfile.write("questPoints = ", 0, 14);
         characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.questPoints), 0, Integer
               .toString(p.questPoints).length());
         characterfile.newLine();
         characterfile.write("quest_1 = ", 0, 10);
         characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.quest_1), 0, Integer
               .toString(p.quest_1).length());

That’s about it. Now to explain the code.

      String s1 = "Bucket of milk";
      String s2 = "Pot of Flour";
      String s3 = "1 Egg";

      if(c.getPA().playerHasItem(1927,1)){
        s1 = "@str@Bucket of milk";
      }
      if(c.getPA().playerHasItem(1933,1)){
        s2 = "@str@Pot of Flour";
      }
      if(c.getPA().playerHasItem(1944,1)){
        s3 = "@str@1 Egg";
      }

This code says, make three strings, and name the strings s1, s2, and s3. Then it says, if you have a Bucket of Milk, then strike through it on the quest journal. Same with the Pot of Flour and the Egg.

   public static void handleButton(Client c, int id) {
      if (id == 28164) {
         switch(c.quest_1){

This says, if the player clicks on the button ID, 28164, it will know that it is quest_1 and will open the quest journal interface.

         case 0:
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("Cook's Assisstant", 7332);
            c.getPA().clearQuestInterface();
            c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("Cook's Assisstant Quest",8144);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("I can start this quest by talking to the Cook.",8147);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("He is located in the Lumbridge Castle.",8148);
            break;
            
         case 1:
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Cook's Assisstant", 7332);
            c.getPA().clearQuestInterface();
            c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("Cook's Assisstant Quest",8144);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@I can start this quest by talking to the Cook.",8147);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@He is located in the Lumbridge Castle.",8148);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("The Cook has asked you to get the following items:",8149);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("s3",8150);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("s1",8151);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("s2",8152);
            break;
            
         case 2:
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@Cook's Assisstant", 7332);
            c.getPA().clearQuestInterface();
            c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("Cook's Assisstant Quest",8144);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@I can start this quest by talking to the Cook.",8147);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@He is located in the Lumbridge Castle.",8148);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@The Cook has asked you to get the following items:",8149);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126(@str@+s3,8150);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126(@str@+s1,8151);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126(@str@+s2,8152);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("@red@QUEST COMPLETED",8153);
            c.getPA().sendFrame126("",8154);
            c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
            break;
         }
      }
   }

This is where it is all displayed. First it occupies line 7332 with the text Cook’s Assisstant. etc;

Next, it clears the quest interface, then it displays the text. Each line on the quest journal has an ID. Here, you are telling it to write the text onto the line. Each case symbolizes where you are in the quest. As you can see, case 0 differs from case 1. On case 0, you haven’t accepted the quest yet, thus it tells you to go talk to the Cook. Whereas in case 1, you just accpeted the quest and you need to retrieve the items for the Cook. It also changes the colour of the quest button to yellow. Enough of that, let’s move on to the next block of code.

   public static void firstClickNpc(Client c, int npcId) {
      switch (npcId) {
      case 278:
         if (c.quest_1 == 0) {
            c.getDH().sendDialogues(1, npcId);
         } else if (c.quest_1 == 1 && c.getItems().playerHasItem(1933, 1)
               && c.getItems().playerHasItem(1944, 1)
               && c.getItems().playerHasItem(1927, 1)) {
            c.getDH().sendDialogues(7, npcId);

         break;
         }
      }
   }

This code says that the firstClickNpc (The person you talk to, to start the quest) is 278. Which is true, the NPC ID of the Cook is 278.

Then it says, if you haven’t started the quest, send the dialogue from case 1 in your DialogueHandler class. Which is,

      case 1:
         sendNpcChat3("Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear I'm in a terrible terrible",
                   "mess! It's the Duke's birthday today, and I should be",
                   "making him a lovely big birthday cake.", c.talkingNpc,
               "Cook");

Makes sense, huh? Then it says if you have the egg. the bucket of milk, and the pot of flour,

         } else if (c.quest_1 == 1 && c.getItems().playerHasItem(1933, 1)
               && c.getItems().playerHasItem(1944, 1)
               && c.getItems().playerHasItem(1927, 1)) {

to send the dialogue from case 7. Which is,

      case 7:
         sendNpcChat2("How are you getting on with finding",
               " the ingredients?", c.talkingNpc,
               "Cook");

Thus case 7 goes to case 8 and that goes to case 9 until you are done talking and you have completed the quest.

Now for this:

CooksAssisstantQuestHandler.handleButton(c, actionButtonId);

This says, if the player clicks on the button ID of the case, you know that it’s Cook’s Assisstant quest, and then it follows through with CooksAssisstantQuestHandler class and does what it says. Which is to open the interface and display the text.

Now for this.

CooksAssisstantQuestHandler.firstClickNpc(c, npcType);

This says, “Hey, just to remind you, NPC ID 278 is the person you talk to, to start CooksAssisstant!” Easy as cake!

Now for DialogueHandler.

      /**
       * Cook's assisstant quest start
       */
      case 1:
         sendNpcChat3("Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear I'm in a terrible terrible",
                   "mess! It's the Duke's birthday today, and I should be",
                   "making him a lovely big birthday cake.", c.talkingNpc,
               "Cook");
         c.nextChat = 2;
         break;
      case 2:
sendNpcChat4("I`ve forgotten to buy the ingredients. I`ll never get",
                   "them in time now. He`ll sack me! What will I do? I have",
                   "four children and a goat to look after. Would you help", 
                  "me please?", c.talkingNpc,
               "Cook");
         c.nextChat = 3;
         break;

      case 3:
         sendPlayerChat1("I'm always happy to help an cook in distress.");
         c.dialogueAction = 104;
         c.quest_1 = 1;
         c.getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Cook's Assisstant", 7332);
         c.nextChat = 5;
         break;
         
      case 4:
         
      case 5:
         sendNpcChat2("Thank you very much! I need an",
               "egg, a bucket of milk and a pot of flour.", c.talkingNpc, "Cook");
         c.nextChat = 6;
         break;
         
      case 6:
         sendPlayerChat1("Okay, I'll see what I can do.");
         c.nextChat = 0;
         break;
         
      case 7:
         sendNpcChat2("How are you getting on with finding",
               " the ingredients?", c.talkingNpc,
               "Cook");

         c.nextChat = 8;
         break;
         
      case 8:
      sendPlayerChat2("Here's a bucket of milk, a pot of",
               "flour, and a fresh egg.");
      c.getItems().deleteItem2(1944, 1);
      c.getItems().deleteItem2(1927, 1);
      c.getItems().deleteItem2(1933, 1);
      c.nextChat = 9;
      break;
      
      case 9:
         sendNpcChat2("You've brought me everything I need! I am saved!",
               "Thank you!", c.talkingNpc, "Cook");
         c.nextChat = 10;
      break;
      
      case 10:
            sendPlayerChat1("So do I get to go the Duke's Party?");
            c.nextChat = 11;
        break;
     
      case 11:
            sendNpcChat2("I'm afraid not, only the big cheeses get to dine", "with the Duke.", c.talkingNpc, "Cook");
            c.nextChat = 12;
        break;

       case 12:
            sendPlayerChat2("Well, maybe one day I'll be important enough to sit on", "the Duke's table.");
            c.nextChat = 13;
        break;
    
       case 13:
            sendNpcChat1("Maybe, but I won't be holding my breath.", c.talkingNpc, "Cook");
            c.nextChat = 14;
        break;
        
      case 14:
         c.getPA().QuestReward(c, "Cook's Assisstant", 2, "300 cooking experience.", "1 Quest Point.", "","","","", 1949);
         c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
         c.questPoints += 2;
         c.quest_1 = 2;
         c.sendMessage("Congratulations, you have completed Cook's Assisstant quest.");
         c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Quest Points: " + c.questPoints, 640);
         c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@Cook's Assisstant", 7332);
         c.getPA().addSkillXP(300, c.playerCooking);
         c.nextChat = 0;
         break;
      case 15:
         sendNpcChat1("Feel free to use my range whenever you please!",
               "", c.talkingNpc,
               "Cook");
         c.nextChat = 0;
         break;

Must I explain? It sends dialogue into the text box through cases. do you see the c.nextChat = #;? That means, "Okay, you’ve displayed this case, now when the player clicks, “Click here to continue” it will display the next case that was specified. That will happen all throughout Dialogues unless you write this:

c.nextChat = 0;

When you type that, it says, “Hey, he’s done talking!” And it stops displaying dialogues.

Now for Player class.

public int quest_1;

This says, “Just to let everybody know, the variable quest_1 is an int! (which is a number). And another heads up, it’s public, which means any class can access it!” quest_1 also let’s CooksAssisstantQuestHandler know where you are in the quest. After all, it has to know what stage you’re on, or else, it wouldn’t know whether to say “Oh dearm oh dear oh dear, I’m in a terrbile terrible mess!” or to say, "“You’ve brought me everything I need! I am saved!”.

Now, moving on to PlayerSave class.

               } else if (token.equals("questPoints")) {
                  p.questPoints = Integer.parseInt(token2);
               } else if (token.equals("quest_1")) {
                  p.quest_1 = Integer.parseInt(token2);
               }

This is saying, “We’re adding something into users’ character files, so we know what stage they are on in the quest they are doing! That way, they won’t have to restart the quest all over again when they log out, and back in! Genius!”.

         characterfile.write("[QUESTS]", 0, 8);
         characterfile.newLine();
         characterfile.write("questPoints = ", 0, 14);
         characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.questPoints), 0, Integer
               .toString(p.questPoints).length());
         characterfile.newLine();
         characterfile.write("quest_1 = ", 0, 10);
         characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.quest_1), 0, Integer
               .toString(p.quest_1).length());

This is basically the same idea. It writes, “quest_1” and “questPoints” into your character file so they know what stage you’re at in the quest, and how many overall quest points you have.

I hope you enjoyed my tutorial, depending on the feedback I get, I’ll release bigger and better quests! Such as Demon Slayer, or Shield of Arrav, and what not.

Thanks for reading.

Read full topic
item.source: 100% Cook's Assistant Quest! [PI or any base] 100% accurate! Well-explained!
